parameters.name: activityIds
parameters.description: The comma-separated list of activity ids to return.  Defaults to all activities.

parameters.name: activityTypes
parameters.description: The comma-separated list of activity types to return.  Defaults to all activity types.

parameters.name: activityIncludes
parameters.description: The comma-separated list of additional properties to return: Details, MinuteSummaries, MapPoints.  Defaults to none.

parameters.name: deviceIds
parameters.description: Filters the set of returned activities based on the comma-separated list of device ids provided.  Defaults to no filter.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Filters the set of returned activities to those starting after the specified ISO 8601 formatted start time, inclusive.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: Filters the set of returned activities to those starting before the specified ISO 8601 formatted end time, exclusive.  Defaults to the current time in UTC.

parameters.name: splitDistanceType
parameters.description: The length of splits used in each activity.  Defaults to Mile.

parameters.name: maxPageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of entries to return per page. Defaults to 1000.

get.summary: Get the details of an activity by activity id.

parameters.name: activityId
parameters.description: The id of the activity to get.

parameters.name: activityIncludes
parameters.description: The comma-separated list of additional properties to return: Details, MinuteSummaries, MapPoints.  Defaults to none.

get.summary: Get the details about the devices associated with this user's Microsoft Health profile.
Get the details about the requested device associated with this user's Microsoft Health profile.
Get the details about this user from their Microsoft Health profile.
Get the summary data for this user by date range

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: The time period for each summary.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: The ISO 8601 formatted start time of the summaries, inclusive.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: The ISO 8601 formatted end time of the summaries, exclusive.  Defaults to the current time in UTC.

parameters.name: deviceIds
parameters.description: The comma-separated list of device ids that generated the data.  Defaults to the aggregation of all devices.  Only a single device id is allowed for Developer Preview.

parameters.name: maxPageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of entries to return per page.  Defaults to 48 for hourly and 31 for daily.

freePlayActivities.description: The collection of free play activities

guidedWorkoutActivities.description: The collection of guided workout activities

nextPage.description: The URI for the next page of data

BikeActivity.description: Bike specific data for a biking activity

activitySegments.description: The segments associated with this activity

performanceSummary.description: The performance summary for the activity

distanceSummary.description: The summary of distance data during the activity

pausedDuration.description: The ISO 8601 formatted length of time the user was paused during the activity

splitDistance.description: The split distance used for the activity

mapPoints.description: The map points for the activity

id.description: The unique identifier of the activity (unique by user)

userId.description: The unique identifier of the user who completed the activity

deviceId.description: The identifier of the device which generated the activity

startTime.description: The ISO 8601 formatted start time of the activity

endTime.description: The ISO 8601 formatted end time of the activity

dayId.description:
The mapping of an event to a logical date. For most events, other than sleep,
            the default assignment is based on the event's start time. This is subject to change
            in the future. For example, if a sleep activity starts before 5 AM, the DayId is the previous day.

numberOfWakeups.description: The number of times the user woke up during the activity

fallAsleepDuration.description: The ISO 8601 formatted length of time it took the user to fall asleep

sleepEfficiencyPercentage.description: The ratio of sleep duration to total duration of the activity

totalRestlessSleepDuration.description: The ISO 8601 formatted length of time the user was in a restless sleep state

totalRestfulSleepDuration.description: The ISO 8601 formatted length of time the user was in a restful sleep state

restingHeartRate.description: The resting heart rate during the activity

fallAsleepTime.description: The ISO 8601 formatted time the user fell asleep

wakeupTime.description: The ISO 8601 formatted time the user woke up

BikeSegment.description: ActivitySegment of a segment of biking

distanceSummary.description: The summary of distance data during the segment

pausedDuration.description: The ISO 8601 formatted length of time the user was paused during the segment

heartRateZones.description: The mapping of the amount of time spent in a given heart rate zone during the segment

splitDistance.description: The split distance used for the segment

segmentId.description: The unique identifier of the segment

startTime.description: The ISO 8601 formatted start time of the segment

endTime.description: The ISO 8601 formatted end time of the segment

duration.description: The ISO 8601 formatted duration of the segment

heartRateSummary.description: The heart rate summary for the segment

caloriesBurnedSummary.description: The summary of calories burned during the segment

PerformanceSummary.description: Summary of the Performance Metrics for an Exercise

finishHeartRate.description: The heart rate when the user finished the exercise

recoveryHeartRateAt1Minute.description: The heart rate one minute after the user finished the exercise

recoveryHeartRateAt2Minutes.description: The heart rate two minutes after the user finished the exercise

heartRateZones.description: The breakdown of the heart rate zones during the exercise

period.description: The length of the time bucket for which the summary is calculated

totalDistance.description:
The total distance during the period.
            If this is a time-based summary, e.g. hourly or daily, then this is the total distance of the period.
            If this is an activity split summary, e.g. splits of a run, then this is the split distance, e.g. 1 mile, 1 kilometer.
            For the last split of the activity, this value may be less than the full split distance.

totalDistanceOnFoot.description: The total distance covered on foot during the period

actualDistance.description: The absolute distance including any paused time distance during the period

elevationGain.description: The cumulative elevation gain accrued during the period in cm

elevationLoss.description: The cumulative elevation loss accrued during this period in cm

maxElevation.description: The maximum elevation during this period in cm

minElevation.description: The minimum elevation during this period in cm

waypointDistance.description: The distance in cm between recorded GPS points

speed.description: The average speed during the period

pace.description: The average pace during the period

overallPace.description: The total distance to the end of this period divided by total time to the end of this period

secondsSinceStart.description: The number of seconds that have elapsed since mapping began, typically the start of a run or other activity

ordinal.description: The absolute ordering of this point relative to the others in its set, starting from 0

actualDistance.description: The distance not including distance traveled while paused, it is the distance that splits are based off of, since splits ignore paused time

totalDistance.description: The total distance from the start point to this map point

heartRate.description: The heart rate at the time of this map point

scaledPace.description:
A number between 0 and 100 that denotes the pace/speed between the slowest and fastest instantaneous pace for the
            overall route. Slowest segment in the route (highest pace, lowest speed) is 0 and fastest segment
            (lowest pace, highest speed) is 100. Only makes sense in the context of the set of all map points.

location.description: The GPS location for this map point

isPaused.description: A value indicating whether or not this map point occurred during paused time

isResume.description: A value indicating whether or not this map point is the first one since the activity resumed

Summary.description: Summary information over a period of time

userId.description: The unique identifier of the user

startTime.description: The ISO 8601 formatted start time of the period

endTime.description: The ISO 8601 formatted end time of the period

parentDay.description: The ISO 8601 formatted parent day of the period

isTransitDay.description: True if the user transitioned time zones during this period, else false

period.description: The length of the time bucket for which the summary is calculated

duration.description: The ISO 8601 formatted duration of the period

stepsTaken.description: The total number of steps taken during the period

caloriesBurnedSummary.description: The summary of the calories burned during the period

heartRateSummary.description: The summary of heart rate data during the period

distanceSummary.description: The summary of the distance data during the period

activeHours.description: The number of active hours during the period

uvExposure.description: The UV exposure as time in the sun.

totalCalories.description: The total calories burned during the period

averageHeartRate.description: The average heart rate achieved during the period

peakHeartRate.description: The peak heart rate achieved during the period

lowestHeartRate.description: The lowest heart rate achieved during the period

HeartRateZones.description:
Distribution of Heart Rates through a range of values defined by Fitness experts 
            which determine the effectiveness of the exercise

underHealthyHeart.description: The number of minutes where the HR was below 50% of the user’s max HR

underAerobic.description:
Note: this field is deprecated. The correct field name is now UnderHealthyHeart. Populated for backwards compatibility until V2
            The number of minutes where the HR was below 50% of the user’s max HR

aerobic.description: The number of minutes where the HR was between 70-80% of the user’s max HR

anaerobic.description: The number of minutes where the HR was between 80-90% of the user’s max HR

fitnessZone.description: The number of minutes where the HR was between 60-70% of the user’s max HR

healthyHeart.description: The number of minutes where the HR was between 50-60% of the user’s max HR

redline.description: The number of minutes where the HR was between 90-100% of the user’s max HR

overRedline.description: The number of minutes above the user’s max HR

speedOverGround.description: The speed over ground for the GPS point in m/s * 100

latitude.description: The latitude for the GPS point in degrees * 10^7 (+ = North)

longitude.description: The longitude for the GPS point in degrees * 10^7 (+ = East)

elevationFromMeanSeaLevel.description: The elevation from mean sea level in m * 100

estimatedHorizontalError.description: The estimated horizontal error in m * 100

estimatedVerticalError.description: The estimated vertical error in m * 100
